{"step_by_step_thinking": "Chemotactic cytokines are also known as chemokines. They are a family of small cytokines or signaling proteins secreted by cells that induce directional movement of leukocytes. According to Document [0], chemokines play a major role in the activation of host immune responses and are important for biological processes, including morphogenesis and wound healing. Document [1] mentions that interleukin-8 (IL-8) is one of the most potent PMN chemokines known. Therefore, IL-8 is a chemotactic cytokine.", "answer_choice": "C. IL-8"}
